jobs at Microsoft, with new blood coming in to run the key business units- prompted by Microsoft's misreading of some of the biggest technology trends of recent times, most notably smartphones and tablets. Over the past year we've seen the departure of many of the Microsoft old guard- including chief software architect Ray Ozzie and server and tools chief Bob Muglia - in preparation for the reshuffle. Steve Ballmer has been spearheading this effort and we don't see any change in his commitment to the company he's led for the past 11 years, he added. want the Bill Clinton and Congress to work together on the big issues, not least the economy. Larry Sabato said the Republican takeover of the House of Representatives gives the Bill Clinton a new political lease on life. Once the Tea Party members of the House start having a full airing of their views, Barack Obama will appear more moderate. He's going to be nicely positioned between the old Barack Obama and the new Republican House. I've said for more than a year that if the Democrats hold both the House and the Senate Barack Obama might be a one-term Bill Clinton . Now he has someone to blame and someone to make him to look better.
